perturbation.original_text: This Product License Schedule is issued pursuant to the Software License, Customization and Maintenance Agreement (the “Agreement”) executed by and between Bank of America, N.A. (“Bank of America”) and Cardlytics, (“Supplier”) and incorporates by reference all of the terms and conditions of the Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: This Product License Schedule is issued pursuant to the Software License, Customization and Maintenance Agreement (the “Agreement”) executed by and between Bank of America, N.A. (“Bank of America”) and Cardlytics, (“Vendor”) and incorporates by reference all of the terms and conditions of the Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Supplier' is changed to 'Vendor'. While seemingly minor, later sections refer exclusively to 'Supplier' creating confusion as to which entity is bound by those obligations. This creates an internal contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: Beginning three (3) years after the General Services Agreement Effective Date, the Supplier Software version in place one (1) year following the Service reaching 10,000,000 Users $[***]
perturbation.changed_text: Beginning three (3) years after the General Services Agreement Effective Date, the Cardlytics Software version in place one (1) year following the Service reaching 10,000,000 Users $[***]
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Supplier Software' to 'Cardlytics Software' introduces ambiguity. While Cardlytics is initially defined as the 'Vendor', this implies the software may be distinct from what a 'Supplier' would provide under the contract, causing confusion.
perturbation.location: Page A-2, Section B, Bullet Point 1

perturbation.original_text: The method of delivery and name of the State where Supplier shall deliver and Bank of America shall receive Software and Documentation: TBD
perturbation.changed_text: The method of delivery and name of the State where Vendor shall deliver and Bank of America shall receive Software and Documentation: TBD
perturbation.explanation: Referencing Vendor here creates direct contradiction as other sections refer to Supplier. It is unclear which entity is responsible for the delivery of the software.
